chapter.title: Defining Service Level Objectives
chapter.para: Your deployment exists to provide service to clients and customers. In order to be successful, therefore, you must set your objectives based on what service levels you provide. This chapter looks at defining your objectives in terms of service levels including availability for different services.

section.title: Identifying Key Services
section.para: TODO: Consider the features in chap-features#server-features. Which of those features are critical to success for the deployment? (Key features are the critical ones.)

section.title: Defining Service Levels
section.para: TODO: For each key service, consider appropriate measurements. For example, throughput for authn, authz decisions, response times for authn, authz decisions, average and peak levels of active sessions and tokens. Also discuss support levels provided to clients using key services. Discuss what levels of security must be provided, as extra network hops, HTTPS, signing and encryption, etc. should be taken into account when testing service performance.

section.title: Defining Availability Levels
section.para: TODO: For each key service, consider availability levels. Consider when services must be available. Do you really require session-level availability? (Users must not have to authenticate again until their session runs out.) Or do you only require service-level availability? (Users must authenticate again if session is lost.) Are there low usage times when services can go offline for maintenance? Do you require fail over across data centers? Or only within data centers? If services must be highly available, what does highly available mean in concrete terms? Define the minimum peak level at which a service is still available.

section.title: Defining Usage Expectations
section.para: TODO: Consider the usage levels you expect, and for which you design the deployment. Consider what level of growth is manageable before the deployment must be expanded to meet service level expectations.

section.title: Monitoring Service Levels
section.para: TODO: For each key service, consider how to measure uptime, throughput, response times at the granularity expected by clients. Consider how you measure and monitor usage, and how you set thresholds to identify when usage looks like it will soon exceed expectations. Consider how you monitor the production deployment in order to react when service levels drop below thresholds.
